analyzed: dāraka dārikā paśyan sa siddhim adhigacchati
translated: Seeing boys and girls, he attains accomplishment.

analyzed: daśa diś sarva buddhānā kṣetrastha paśyati dhruvam
translated: He certainly sees in the Buddha-fields of the Buddhas of the ten directions,

analyzed: dadanti hṛṣṭa citta ātmā dharmagañja manoramam
translated: Delighting in the Dharma treasury, they bestow it with a joyful mind.

analyzed: dharmacakragata kāya sarva buddhaiḥ parivṛtam
translated: The body abiding in the wheel of Dharma, surrounded by all the Buddhas,

analyzed: paśyate yoga samaye dhyāna vajra pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He sees at the time of yoga, established in the vajra of meditation.

analyzed: ārama udyāna vividhān sura kanyā ādi alaṅkṛtān
translated: Various pleasure gardens, adorned with celestial maidens and so forth,

analyzed: paśyati dhyāna samaye sarva buddhaiḥ adhiṣṭhitān
translated: He sees at the time of meditation, empowered by all the Buddhas.

analyzed: buddhaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ ca abhiṣikta sa paśyati
translated: He sees himself consecrated by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: vidyādhara mahā rājaiḥ pūjyamāna sa paśyati
translated: Honored by the great kings of the vidyadharas.

analyzed: iti āha ca
translated: Thus it is said:

analyzed: vividhān vajra sambhūtān svapnān paśyati nirmalān
translated: He sees various pure dreams born of the vajra,

analyzed: tasya
translated: He attains the unsurpassed, born of the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: caṇḍāla śvāna yoga ādīn paśyati yadi vajra dhīḥ
translated: If the vajra-minded one sees the yoga of the chandala dog and so forth,

analyzed: sidhyate citta nilaya vajra sattvasya dhīmataḥ
translated: The abode of the mind is accomplished, of the wise Vajrasattva.

analyzed: tatra idam svapna vicāraṇa samaya hṛdayam
translated: Here is the essence of the time of investigating dreams:

analyzed: sva citta citta nidhi aptau sarva dharmāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: All phenomena are established in the ascertainment of one's own mind.

original: khavajrasthā hyamī dharmā na dharmā na ca dharmatā // //
analyzed: kha vajra sthāḥ hi amī dharmāḥ na dharmāḥ na ca dharma tā
translated: These phenomena, abiding in the vajra of space, are neither phenomena nor the nature of phenomena.

original: atha bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptāḥ sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittasaśayacchettāra vajrasattva papracchuḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta saśaya chettāra vajra sattva papracchuḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Ones, all the Tathagatas, having attained wonder and amazement, asked Vajrasattva, the cutter of doubts regarding the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas:

analyzed: bhagavan niḥsvabhāveṣu dharmeṣu dharma tattvam udāhṛtam
translated: What is this, O Blessed One, the truth of phenomena spoken of regarding phenomena that are essenceless?

analyzed: aho vismaya sambhūtam ākāśa ākāśa bhāvanam
translated: Ah! The meditation on space, arisen from wonder!

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: atha bhagavān kāya vāc citta vajrapāṇiḥ tathāgataḥ sarva tathāgatān evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vajrapani of Body, Speech, and Mind, the Tathagata, said this to all the Tathagatas:

original: bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā ākāśa na kenaciddharmeṇa sayukta nāpyasayuktam na cākāśasyaiva bhavati /
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ ākāśa na kenacid dharmeṇa na api a sayuktam na ca ākāśasya eva bhavati
translated: O Blessed Ones, all Tathagatas, space is not associated with any phenomenon, nor is it dissociated. It is not even space itself.

analyzed: sarva gataḥ ya sarvatra anudarśī ca
translated: It is all-pervading, and it does not observe anywhere.

original: evameva bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svapnāḥ svapnasamayasambhūtāścānugantavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva dharmāḥ svapnāḥ svapna samaya sambhūtāḥ ca anugantavyāḥ
translated: In the same way, O Blessed Ones, all Tathagatas, all phenomena should be understood as dreams and as arisen at the time of dreams.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ ākāśam a nirūpyam a nidarśanam a pratipādyam
translated: Just as, Blessed Ones, all Tathāgatas are space, formless, invisible, and inexpressible,

analyzed: evabhā iva bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva dharmāḥ anugantavyāḥ
translated: in the same way, Blessed Ones, all dharmas should be understood.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ sarvadharmakāyavākcittavajrapadasamaya sarvatrānugatamekasvabhāva yaduta cittasvabhāvam /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva dharmakāya vāc citta vajra pada samaya sarvatra anugatam eka svabhāva yat uta citta svabhāvam
translated: Just as, Blessed Ones, all Tathāgatas, by the pledge of the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all dharmas, are present everywhere as a single nature, namely the nature of mind,

analyzed: yaḥ ca kāya vāc citta dhātuḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkaram
translated: and the element of body, speech, and mind, and the element of space, are non-dual, indivisible,

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā ākāśadhātusthitāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ ākāśa dhātu sthitāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: just as, Blessed Ones, all dharmas abide in the element of space,

original: sa cākāśadhāturna kāmadhātusthito na rūpadhātusthito nārūpadhātusthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca ākāśa dhātuḥ na kāmadhātu sthitaḥ na rūpadhātu sthitaḥ na a rūpa dhātu sthitaḥ
translated: and that element of space does not abide in the desire realm, does not abide in the form realm, does not abide in the formless realm,

original: yaśca dharmadhātustraidhātuke na sthitaḥ tasyotpādo nāsti /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dharmadhātuḥ traidhātuke na sthitaḥ tasya utpādaḥ na asti
translated: and that dharma element which does not abide in the three realms has no origination,

original: yasyotpādo nāsti nāsau kenacit dharmeṇa sambhāvyate /
analyzed: yasya utpādaḥ na asti na asau kenacid dharmeṇa sambhāvyate
translated: and that which has no origination is not imagined by anyone,

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā niḥsvabhāvāḥ sarvadharmā iti /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ niḥsvabhāvāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti
translated: therefore, Blessed Ones, all dharmas are essenceless, all Tathāgatas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā bodhicitta sarvatathāgatajñānotpādanavajrapadakaram /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ bodhi citta sarva tathāgata jñāna utpādana vajra pada karam
translated: Just as, Blessed Ones, all the Tathāgatas, by the mind of enlightenment, produce the vajra-word that generates the knowledge of all the Tathāgatas.

original: tacca bodhicitta na kāyasthita na vāksthita na cittasthitam /
analyzed: tat ca bodhi citta na kāya sthita na vāc sthita na citta sthitam
translated: And that mind of enlightenment is not located in the body, nor in speech, nor in the mind.

analyzed: yaḥ ca dharmaḥ traidhātuke na sthitaḥ tasya utpādaḥ na asti
translated: And that which is not located in the three realms has no origination.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata jñāna utpādana vajra padam
translated: This is the vajra-word that generates the knowledge of all the Tathāgatas.

original: na ca bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ svapnasyaiva bhavati aha traidhātuke svapnapada darśayeyam /
analyzed: na ca bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ svapnasya eva bhavati aha traidhātuke svapna pada darśayeyam
translated: And, Blessed Ones, all the Tathāgatas do not think, I will show the state of a dream in the three realms.

original: na ca puruṣasyaiva bhavati aha svapna paśyeyamiti /
analyzed: na ca puruṣasya eva bhavati aha svapna paśyeyam iti
translated: And a man does not think, I will have a dream.

original: sā ca traidhātukakriyā svapnopamā svapnasadṛśī svapnasambhūtā /
analyzed: sā ca traidhātuka kriyā svapna upamā svapna sadṛśī svapna sambhūtā
translated: And that activity of the three realms is like a dream, similar to a dream, arisen from a dream.

original: evameva bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā yāvanto daśadiksarvalokadhātuṣu buddhāśca bodhisattvāśca yāvantaḥ sarvasattvāḥ sarve te svapnanairātmyapadenānugantavyāḥ
analyzed: evam eva bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ yāvantaḥ daśa diś sarva lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ ca bodhisattvāḥ ca yāvantaḥ sarva sattvāḥ sarve te svapna nairātmya padena anugantavyāḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed Ones, all the Tathāgatas, as many as there are Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in all the world systems of the ten directions, and all sentient beings, all of them should be understood through the state of the selflessness of dreams.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ cintāmaṇiratna sarvaratnapradhāna sarvaguṇopetam /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ cintāmaṇi ratna sarva ratna pradhāna sarva guṇa upetam
translated: Just as, Blessed Ones, all the Tathāgatas are the most precious of all jewels, endowed with all good qualities,

original: ye ca sattvāḥ prārthayanti suvarṇa vā ratna vā raupya vā tat sarva cintāmātreṇaiva sampādayanti /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ prārthayanti suvarṇa vā ratna vā raupya vā tat sarva cintā mātreṇa eva sampādayanti
translated: and those beings who wish for gold, jewels, or silver, all that is accomplished merely by thinking of it,

original: tacca ratnādya na cittasthita na cintāmaṇisthitam /
analyzed: tat ca ratna adya na citta sthita na cintāmaṇi sthitam
translated: and that jewel and so forth is not located in the mind nor located in the wish-fulfilling jewel.

analyzed: evam eva bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva dharmāḥ anugantavyāḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed Ones, all dharmas of the Tathāgatas should be understood.

original: atha bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ praharṣotphullalocanāḥ sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajra tathāgatamevamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ praharṣa utphulla locanāḥ sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra tathāgatam evam āhuḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Ones, all the Tathāgatas, with eyes expanded with joy, said this to the Tathāgata Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathāgatas:

original: āścarya bhagavan yatra hi nāma ākāśadhātu samavasareṣu sarvadharmeṣu buddhadharmāḥ samavasaraṇa gacchanti /
analyzed: āścarya bhagavan yatra hi nāma ākāśadhātu samavasareṣu sarva dharmeṣu buddha dharmāḥ samavasaraṇa gacchanti
translated: It is wonderful, Blessed One, that in all dharmas which are the same as space, the Buddha-dharmas are included.

original: atha te sarvabuddhabodhisattvā bhagavanto vajrapāṇestathāgatasya pādayoḥ praṇipatyaivamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te sarva buddha bodhisattvāḥ bhagavantaḥ vajrapāṇeḥ tathāgatasya pādayoḥ praṇipatya evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all those Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, the Blessed Ones, having bowed at the feet of the Tathāgata Vajrapāṇi, said this:

original: yadbhagavatā sarvamantravajrasiddhisamuccaya bhāṣita tāni ca sarvamantravajrasamuccayasiddhīni kutra sthitāni /
analyzed: yat bhagavatā sarva mantra vajra siddhi samuccaya tāni ca sarva mantra vajra samuccaya siddhīni kutra sthitāni
translated: Where are those accomplishments of all mantras and vajras, which the Blessed One has spoken, and those accomplishments of the collection of all mantras and vajras located?

original: atha vajrapāṇisteṣā tathāgatānā bodhisattvānā ca sādhukāra dattvā tān sarvatathāgatānevamāha /
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ teṣā tathāgatānā bodhisattvānā ca sādhukāra dattvā tān sarva tathāgatān evam āha
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, having given his approval to those Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, said this to all the Tathāgatas:

original: na ca bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ sarvamantrasiddhīni sarvamantrakāyavākcittavajrasthitāni /
analyzed: na ca bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva mantra siddhīni sarva mantra kāya vāc citta vajra sthitāni
translated: Blessed Ones, all the accomplishments of all mantras, all the mantras of body, speech, and mind, are not established in the vajra.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: paramārthataḥ kāya vāc citta mantra siddhīnām asambhavāt
translated: Because in ultimate truth, the accomplishments of body, speech, and mind mantras are impossible.

original: kintu bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ sarvamantrasiddhīni sarvabuddhadharmāṇi svakāyavākcittavajrasthitāni /
analyzed: kintu bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva mantra siddhīni sarva buddha dharmāṇi sva kāya vāc citta vajra sthitāni
translated: However, Blessed Ones, all the accomplishments of all mantras, all the qualities of the Buddhas, are established in one's own body, speech, and mind vajras.

original: tacca kāyavākcitta ca kāmadhātusthita na rūpa dhātusthita nā rūpadhātusthitam /
analyzed: tat ca kāya vāc citta ca kāmadhātu sthita na rūpa dhātu sthita na rūpadhātu sthitam
translated: And that body, speech, and mind are not located in the desire realm, not located in the form realm, not located in the formless realm.

original: na citta kāyasthita na kāyaścittasthitaḥ na vāk cittasthitā na citta vāksthitam /
analyzed: na citta kāya sthita na kāyaḥ citta sthitaḥ na vāc citta sthitā na citta vāc sthitam
translated: The mind is not located in the body, the body is not located in the mind, speech is not located in the mind, the mind is not located in speech.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ākāśa vat svabhāva śuddha tvāt
translated: Because of the purity of their nature, like space.

analyzed: atha te sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra tathāgatam evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas said to the Tathagata Vajra Body, Speech and Mind of all Tathagatas:

original: sarvatathāgatadharmā bhagavan kutra sthitāḥ kva vā sambhūtāḥ /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharmāḥ bhagavan kutra sthitāḥ kva vā sambhūtāḥ
translated: O Blessed One, where are the Dharmas of all Tathagatas situated, and where do they originate?

analyzed: vajrasattvaḥ āha
translated: Vajrasattva said:

analyzed: sva kāya vāc citta sasthitāḥ sva kāya vāc citta sambhūtāḥ
translated: They are situated in one's own body, speech and mind, and originate from one's own body, speech and mind.

analyzed: bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ āhuḥ
translated: The Blessed Ones, all the Tathagatas, said:

analyzed: sva kāya vāc citta vajra kutra sthitam
translated: Where is one's own body, speech and mind Vajra situated?

analyzed: ākāśa sthitam
translated: It is situated in space.

analyzed: ākāśa kutra sthitam na kvacid
translated: Where is space situated? Nowhere.

original: atha te sarvabuddhabodhisattvā āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptāḥ svacittadharmatāvihāra dhyāyastūṣṇī sthitā abhūvanniti /
analyzed: atha te sarva buddha bodhisattvāḥ āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ sva citta dharmatā vihāra dhyāyaḥ tūṣṇī sthitāḥ abhūvan iti
translated: Then all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, having attained wonder and amazement, contemplated the dwelling in the nature of their own minds, and remained silent.

original: iti śrīsarvatathāgatakāyavākcittarahasyātirahasye guhyasamāje mahāguhyatantrarāje sarvacittasamayasāravajrasambhūtirnāma paṭalaḥ pañcadaśo'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta rahasya ati rahasye guhya samāje mahā guhya tantra rāje sarvacittasamayasāravajrasambhūtiḥ nāma paṭalaḥ pañcadaśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter, named the origin of the essence of the mind pledge vajra, in the great tantra of the great secret, the glorious Secret Assembly, the utmost secret of the body, speech and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: ṣoḍaśaḥ paṭalaḥ atha bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ punaḥ samājamāgamya bhagavanta sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajra tathāgata sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajrapadairadhyeṣya
analyzed: ṣoḍaśaḥ paṭalaḥ atha bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ punar samājam āgamya bhagavanta sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra tathāgata sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra padaiḥ adhyeṣya
translated: Chapter 16 Then the Blessed Ones, all the Tathagatas, having again assembled, requested the Blessed One, the Tathagata of Body, Speech and Mind Vajra, with the words of all the Tathagatas' Body, Speech and Mind Vajra:

analyzed: sarva tathāgata ratna vajra pūjā vyūhaiḥ pūjayāmāsuḥ
translated: Worship the Blessed One, the Tathagata of Body, Speech and Mind Vajra, with the arrays of worship of all the Tathagatas' jewels and vajras.

original: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇistathāgataḥ sarvavajramaṇḍalasiddhisamayarājavyūha nāma samādhi samāpadyeda vajrakāyamaṇḍala sarvabuddhānā svakāyavākcittavajrebhyo
analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ tathāgataḥ sarva vajra maṇḍala siddhi samaya rāja vyūha nāma samādhi samāpadya idam vajra kāya maṇḍala sarva buddhānā sva kāya vāc citta vajrebhyaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vajrapani, the Tathagata, entered the samadhi called Array of the King of Samayas for the Accomplishment of all Vajra Mandalas, and from his vajra body, speech and mind mandala,

analyzed: niścārayāmāsa
translated: he caused this to issue forth:

analyzed: atha atas sa pravakṣyāmi kāya maṇḍalam uttamam
translated: Now I will explain the supreme body mandala.

analyzed: citta vajra pratīkāśa sarva maṇḍalam uttamam
translated: Resembling the mind vajra, it is the supreme mandala of all.

original: ṣoḍaśahasta prakurvīta caturasra suśobhanam /🔽maṇḍala sarvabuddhānā kāyavajrapratiṣṭhitam // //🔽tasyābhyantarataścakramālikhedvidhivajrayā /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa hasta prakurvīta catur asra su śobhanam  maṇḍala sarva buddhānā kāya vajra pratiṣṭhitam  tasya abhyantaratas cakram ālikhet vidhivajrayā
translated: One should make it sixteen cubits, square and very beautiful.🔽The mandala of all the Buddhas, established in the vajra body.🔽And in its center one should draw a wheel with the vajra method.

analyzed: kuryāt mantrāṇām guhyam uttamam
translated: One should make the mudra of the vajra abode, the supreme secret of the mantras.

analyzed: madhye vairocana padam akṣobhya ādīn samālikhet
translated: In the middle, one should draw the seat of Vairocana and Akshobhya, and so on.

analyzed: kāya vāc citta vajra agrīn sarva koṇe niveśayet
translated: One should place the foremost of body, speech, and mind vajras in all the corners.

analyzed: krodhān samālikhet dvāri mahā bala parākramān
translated: One should draw the wrathful ones at the door, of great strength and valor.

analyzed: pūjā kurvīta mantra jñaḥ guhya vajra prabhāvitām
translated: The knower of mantras should make offerings, inspired by the secret vajra.

analyzed: eṣaḥ hi sarva krodhānā samayaḥ duratikramaḥ
translated: This is the rule of all wrathful ones, difficult to transgress.

analyzed: avaśyam eva dātavya viṣ mutra adya viśeṣataḥ
translated: One should definitely give feces, urine, and so forth, especially.

analyzed: eṣaḥ hi sarva mantrāṇām samayaḥ kāya vajriṇām
translated: This is the rule of all mantras, of those with vajra bodies.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata kāya maṇḍalam
translated: The maṇḍala of the body of all tathāgatas.

original: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇistathāgataḥ sarvavāgvajrasamayameghavyūha nāma samādhi samāpadyeda vāgvajramaṇḍala svakāyavākcittavajrebhya udājahāra
analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ tathāgataḥ sarva vāc vajra samaya meghavyūha nāma samādhi samāpadi idam vāc vajra maṇḍala sva kāya vāc citta vajrebhyaḥ udājahāra
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vajrapāṇi, the Tathāgata, entered the samādhi called The Cloud Array of the Samaya of All Speech Vajras and proclaimed this speech vajra maṇḍala from his vajra body, speech, and mind:

analyzed: atha atas sa pravakṣyāmi vāc maṇḍalam uttamam
translated: Now, I will explain the supreme speech maṇḍala.

analyzed: citta vajra pratīkāśa sarva maṇḍalam uttamam  viśatihasta prakurvīta caturasra vidhānataḥ
translated: Resembling the mind vajra, it is the supreme maṇḍala of all.🔽One should make it twenty cubits, quadrangular, according to the rules.

analyzed: catuṣkoṇa catur dvāra sūtrayet vajra bhāvanaiḥ
translated: With four corners and four doors, one should draw it with vajra contemplations.

translated: In the crown of the vajra of body, speech and mind, think of meditation, and all will be accomplished by the three vajra laws, and no one can conquer the angry one.🔽 Then Vajrapani, Lord of all Tathagatas, brought forth from his vajra body, speech and mind this law of the secret of all vajra-knowledge:🔽In the crown of the vajra of body, speech and mind, think of meditation, and all will be accomplished by the three vajra laws, and no one can conquer the angry one.🔽 Then Vajrapani, Lord of all Tathagatas, brought forth from his vajra body, speech and mind this law of the secret of all vajra-knowledge:🔽In the crown of the vajra of body, speech and mind, think of meditation, and all will be accomplished by the three vajra laws, and no one can conquer the angry one.

original: atha vajrapāṇiḥ sarvatathāgatādhipatiḥ sarvamantradharādikarmikasamaya svakāyavākcittavajrebhyo niścārayāmāsa //

and the Vajra Dharma, should always be performed by the rite of opening the sutra.

translated: Then Vajrapani, Lord of all Tathagatas, having contemplated the equality of his own vajra body, speech, mind and heart, became silent.

analyzed: atha khalu anabhilāpya anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarva tathāgatān praṇipatya evam āhuḥ

analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata adhipatiḥ tān sarva bodhisattvān evam āha

analyzed: asya ca kula putrāḥ sarva tathāgata adhipateḥ cintayā etat abhūt

analyzed: kāya akṣaram anutpanna vāc citta pada lakṣaṇam
translated: The syllable of the body is unborn, the characteristic of the word and mind is unborn.

analyzed: kha vajra kalpanā bhūta mithyā sagraha sagraham
translated: It is like the vajra of space, falsely imagined, grasped as grasped.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: atha mañjuśrī pramukhāḥ mahā bodhisattvāḥ tān sarva tathāgatān evam āhuḥ
translated: Then the great bodhisattvas headed by Mañjuśrī said this to all the tathāgatas:

analyzed: mā bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ vāc vajra pada mithyā samudayena kalpayatha
translated: Blessed ones, all tathāgatas, do not imagine the syllable of vajra speech as falsely arisen.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva tathāgata vajra dhātuṣu avacarita gatānugatikaḥ ya sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra adhipatiḥ
translated: This lord of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas moves and follows in all the vajra realms of the tathāgatas.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: santi brahmādyā mahābodhisattvā mahābhijñājñānasaprāptāḥ sarvadharmalakṣaṇasvabhāvamajānanta eva vikalpayanti //
analyzed: santi brahma ādyāḥ mahā bodhisattvāḥ mahā abhijñā jñāna sa prāptāḥ sarva dharma lakṣaṇa svabhāvam a jānantaḥ eva vikalpayanti
translated: There are great bodhisattvas such as Brahmā who have attained the great knowledge of higher knowledge, but not knowing the nature of the characteristics of all phenomena, they imagine.

translated: Why do you teach the secret syllables without understanding the truth of the vajra of all tathāgatas, the vajra of all tathāgata dharmas?

analyzed: atha bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ tān bodhisattvān evam āhuḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Ones, all the tathāgatas, said to those bodhisattvas:

original: tiṣṭhantu tāvat bhavanto mahābodhisattvā vayamapi sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajraguhyākṣara prāpya kāyavākcittabodhi na jānīmahe /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu tāvat bhavantaḥ mahā bodhisattvāḥ vayam api sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra guhya akṣara prāpya kāya vāc citta bodhi na jānīmahe
translated: Wait, you great bodhisattvas! We also, having attained the secret syllables of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, do not know the enlightenment of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
